description.narrative: This project will contribute to institutional stabilization of the media sector in Guinea-Bissau by helping create better conditions for journalists to perform their role in a democratic society in a more professional and responsible manner.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Indicator 1.1.1: Licensing statutes of the Commission for Journalist revised, approved, published and disseminated Indicator 1.1.2: Statute of National Council of Social Communication revised and harmonized with media laws Indicator 1.1.3: # of sensitizations discussions held to socialize the Code of Conduct with government and politicians and other relevant stakeholders Indicator 1.2.1: Budget allocation to media Sector approved by government Indicator 1.3.1: # of sensitizations discussions Indicator 2.1.1: Relationship between media owners and media managers improves Indicator 2.2.1: Representatives of Union of journalists and community radios network elected in democratic elections Indicator 2.3.1: Independent Media Consortium (IMC) Legalized Indicator 2.4.1: Budget allocation to media Sector approved by government Indicator 2.5.1:Solar panels installed with security mechanisms Indicator 2.6.1:Women more confident to voice concerns on radio thanks to Women Radio of Bafata Indicator 3.1.1: # of Journalist and Aspirants Trained in the AD professional center school Indicator 3.2.1: Equipment purchased for the multimedia center Indicator 3.3.1:# of reports broadcast for the Educational TV and radio series produced through small grants program Indicator 3.4.1: # of episodes produced for the TV and radio program focused on civic education and peace produced and broadcasted at national level

comment.narrative: 1.1.1. 0 1.2.1. Not applicable 1.3.1. 0 2.1.1. Not applicable 2.2.1. Not applicable 2.3.1. Not applicable 2.4.1. Not applicable 2.5.1. 0 2.6.1. Not applicable 3.1.1. Not applicable 3.2.1. Not applicable 3.3.1.0 3.4.1.0 3.5.1. 0

Statutes of the National Council of Social Communication reviewed • Media owners and managers trained on entrepreneurship and organized in association • Independent Media Consortium created and functional • Union of Journalists elected his representatives • Association of Women Journalist elected his representatives • Network of Community Radios (RENARC) elected his representatives • “Ordem de jornalistas” (professional journalists association) elected his representatives • Ministry of Social communication (General-Director) to approve two pieces of laws • Bafata Women’s Radio (RMB) trained and able to function

o 1. 1rst Bissau-Guinean Soap opera: 1 script written, 1 baseline and 3 episodes written. Writers have been trained into conflict prevention and Scriptwriting o 2. Elections: fact-checking team worked for the 3 elections. o 3. 1rst Bissau-Guinean professional journalism training course: The school has been constructed and the equipment were bought. o 4. Media entrepreneurship: 3 companies received a grant to implement news activities aiming at the independence of the sector o 5. Draft Law: To date, 3 laws were drafted and are waiting for government/parliament approval. o 6. Investigative journalism: 9 investigative projects are underway and receive the support of the International Center for Investigative Journalism

o Telenovela have 20 episodes written and 3 episodes produced o Draft laws: have 3 law approved by the Assembly or the Government o School: school is open with teachers recruited and 40 students registered o Investigative Journalism: 9 projects published o Media entrepreneurship: 3 companies settled

• Consultant developed a Lobbying strategy (February 2020) • The journalist’s Union implemented the advocacy the lobbying decision- makers strategy (March 2020) • 3 media entrepreneurship grants and coaching offered to 3 women with innovative ideas on Media (January 2020) • Consortium of media sets a Business Plan to ensure auto-sustainability and recruits a Manager (January 2020) • Training in Fake-news for 15 journalists in the Consortium multimedia centre (June 2020) • The Bafata Women Radio received a grant to produce health and drug investigative journalism program (still on going) • 7 journalism investigation reports published • School of journalism equipped, teachers hired, curriculum defined for 2.5 years of study, and 40 students registered (March 2020) • 5 women received a grant to study journalism after a competitive selection test (February 2020) • 22 journalism, law, political manuals written for the school (March 2020) • 50 journalists from Bissau and regions trained during 2 days on Conflict Prevention (February 2020) • An e-training on Coronavirus was produced with experts on 4 topics (State of Emergency, Fake-news, Protection, Prevention) and distributed through the internet and a USB drives on the 150 journalists of the country (May 2020) • Multimedia Center built and fully equipped (radio room; TV room ; Press room, Library ; conference room) (January 2020) • Professional printer bought (still in Dakar, due to the border closure) (June 2020) • A Civil society organization Innovalab was supported to implement the first fact-checking website of the country. They started with demystifying fake-news about Coronavirus (78 articles written and 36 radio spots produced) (April - May 2020) • 32 episodes of the telenovela wrote
